page.title: 17CHURCHES IN EVERCREECH AREA
page.content:
ST.PETER'S CHURCH The first known reference to Evercreech was made in the year 1066.Two kinds of stone have been used to build Evercreech church.The church clock and chimes comemmorate the Diamond Jubilee of Queen Victoria(1879).Along the south side of the church are three gargoyles done by a stone mason from Wells in 1842.Whilst working here he had a disagreement with the Vicar,the publican and two women whom he portrayed as a hideous monster,(the Vicar),a monkey,(the publican)and two gossiping cats,(the women).
THE METHODIST CHURCH The Methodist Church is in Weymouth Road.It is much smaller than the Parish Church.The school room is used by a nursery school during the week.
